bibl.title: Emptio Bovis Frisica: the „Frisian Ox Sale“ Reconsidered
bibl.note: Wooden stilus tablet found in the Netherlands (near the town of Franeker) a few years before the Great War and deposited in the Frisian Museum at Leeuwarden (A.E. 1919, 51 = F.I.R.A. III, 137). - [Revised text and notes.] - Historical context. - Format and legal formulary. - Palaeography. - Refer to the Vindolanda tablets.
bibl.seg: 145.5 T. Leeuwarden Frisian Mus. sans No. d'Inv.
BOWMAN A.K., R.S.O. TOMLIN and K.A. WORP, Emptio Bovis Frisica: The 'Frisian Ox Sale' Reconsidered.
JRS 99 (2009) pp. 156-170, 4 figg. et pll. I-IV.

Wooden stilus tablet found in the Netherlands (near the town of Franeker) a few years before the Great War and deposited in the Frisian Museum at Leeuwarden (A.E. 1919, 51 = F.I.R.A. III, 137). - [Revised text and notes.] - Historical context. - Format and legal formulary. - Palaeography. - Refer to the Vindolanda tablets.
